summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a reply letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel and a court order from Judge Nathan regarding concerns about Maxwell's communication with counsel at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It shows routine legal correspondence between Maxwell's defense team and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, sending courtesy copies of ECF filings and correspondence to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case, likely part of the legal team.

persons.name: Laura Menninge
persons.context: Listed in the email signature of Bobbi C. Sternheim, likely administrative or paralegal staff.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed in the email signature of Bobbi C. Sternheim, likely administrative or paralegal staff.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued an order finding that the MDC's response addressed concerns about Maxwell's communication with counsel.

connections.description: Both are part of the legal correspondence regarding the Maxwell case, with Everdell copied on emails.
Menninge is listed in Sternheim's email signature, indicating a staff relationship.
Pagliuca is listed in Sternheim's email signature, indicating a staff relationship.

events.title: Court Order on MDC Communication
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order finding that the MDC's response addressed concerns about Ghislaine Maxwell's communication with her counsel.

events.title: Filing Courtesy Copy Sent
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Letter re VTCs Filed
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim filed a letter regarding video teleconferences (VTCs) and sent a courtesy copy to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: Judge Nathan issued an order on August 25, 2021, addressing concerns about Ghislaine Maxwell's ability to communicate with her counsel while detained at the MDC.
The email chain shows routine legal correspondence between Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The document references the ongoing criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
Attachments include a reply letter from Maxwell's counsel and the court order from Judge Nathan.
The email includes standard legal disclaimers about confidentiality and privilege from Sternheim's law office.
